top_comments_top.body: Loved 2033 and Last Light and bought Exodus when it first came out on PS4. Couldn't get into it at all and dropped it just after the first open area because it was such a change from the first two games. Just gave it another shot on Series X and honestly it's one of my favourite games of all time now. The DLC is fantastic too. Plus it looks amazing.
Could never get into this game, is it worth it?

I loved Exodus' story, but I think I would have preferred a sequel largely set in the Metro itself. The cramped, claustrophobic environments and supernatural elements were a big part of the series' identity and it was disappointing seeing them get downplayed. Regardless, I can respect the devs' attempt to try something new with the franchise.
Super disappointed in this game, turned a great series into another mediocre open world rpg.
